title: China launches new Gaofen-11 high resolution spy satellite
summary: China added a fifth Gaofen-11 high resolution satellite to its CHEOS constellation with a launch late Thursday.

title: Hubble Studies a Potential Galactic Merger
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image features the dwarf irregular galaxy NGC 5238, located 14.5 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Canes Venatici. Its unexciting, blob-like appearance seems to resemble an oversized star cluster more than a classic image of a galaxy. Its lackluster appearance belies its complicated structure, which is the subject of […]

title: Earth from Space: Central Ethiopia
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-1 mission brings us a false-colour radar image of central Ethiopia.

title: Astra completes deal to go private
summary: Astra Space ended more than three years as a public company July 18 by completing a deal to take the company private at a tiny fraction of what it was once valued at.

title: Enhanced Dragon spacecraft to deorbit the ISS at the end of its life
summary: SpaceX will develop a souped-up version of its Dragon spacecraft for NASA to handle the deorbiting of the International Space Station around the end of the decade.

title: From One Crew to Another: Artemis II Astronauts Meet NASA Barge Crew
summary: Members of the Artemis II crew met with the crew of NASA’s Pegasus barge prior to their departure to deliver the core stage of NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket to the Space Coast. NASA astronaut and pilot of the Artemis II mission Victor Glover met the crew July 15. NASA astronaut Reid Wiseman, commander, […]

title: Sols 4248-4249: Lunch at Fairview Dome
summary: Earth planning date: Wednesday, July 17, 2024 We started our day at an outcrop called “Fairview Dome,” a light-colored rock so big that it can easily be seen from orbit! We have had our eye on Fairview Dome since Curiosity descended into the Gediz Vallis channel. As a geologist who has spent a lot of […]
